title: Newsletter 296:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Winter in 1949 consisted school, hanging out with friends, and delivering newspapers but done in freezing cold and snowy conditions. Newspaper delivery was a lucrative job for kids. Included is an image of the old Ely Drugstore, which is now a vacant lot.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 297:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Large vs small town life. There are benefits to both - life in McGill is the later, of course! The present-day drugstore's furnace room gets new insulation!
subject: Main Street

title: Newsletter 298:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill school was in session despite snow, cold, rain, heat or wind. Kids were not coddled and allowed to play outside regardless of the amount of snow or cold weather! The present-day furnace room is nearing completion.
subject: Schools

title: Newsletter 299:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images of the 'old' (K-5th grades) and the 'new' (6th-8th grades). Keith recalls some memorable teachers from this era.
subject: Schools;People

title: Newsletter 300:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Letting go of anger as we age is sometimes the best medicine. Quotes to live by.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 301:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The days when kids worked hard to make money. The cost of living was much less in those days and a dollar when a long way. Kids assumed they would have a job (any job) as soon as they were able. They started early and worked very hard.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 302:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Prices for goods and services were quite affordable during the 1950s, when gas was 12 cents a gallon and a burger and fries was 35 cents. Add 10 cents for a Coke and your total for a combo meal came to 45 cents. One could actually live on $1 an hour wages.Times have certainly changed. Are we prepared for the inflation to come?
subject: People

title: Newsletter 303:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of 1950s college days, more affordable meals and fun employment. The present-day Drugstore gets some new displays!
subject: People

title: Newsletter 304:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Lots of interesting and unique items uncovered from the dark corners of the Drugstore.  These will soon be put on display. Can you guess what they are?
subject: Drugstores

title: Newsletter 305:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More potions and medicines have been unearthed. Remedies that were commonly used in the 1930s and 1940s (prior to the FDA) were ultimately found to be toxic and removed from production.
subject: Drugstores

title: Newsletter 306:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The purpose of the old tailings ditches is explained. These ditches were used to carry the waste from the mill to the area below McGill.
subject: Duck Creek;Tailings

title: Newsletter 307:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Fred and 'Toots' Feld, who operated the largest vegetable garden in McGill. Many other McGill residents cultivated 'Victory Gardens' during WWII.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 308:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A great image of the McGIll Club and some of its patrons is shown. The origins of the monthly magazine named 'Kenevadan' is discussed.
subject: Businesses;People

title: Newsletter 309:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Efforts to preserve some of the old mold-covered documents from the back room of the Drugstore. Some were saved, some not. The new website, www.mcgillnvheritage.com is now live!
subject: Drugstores

title: Newsletter 311:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of baseball games (Prunepeddlers vs. Pendraggers, circa 1930) and the KCC men's boarding house.
subject: Baseball;Kennecott

title: Newsletter 312:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Images of the proposed Hotel Nevada and the old Northern Hotel.
subject: Hotels

title: Newsletter 313:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Spring break, circa 1950. Camping was a fun activity to participate in during the Spring respite. Scanning begins on the 10 years of invoices from the 1960s. When completed, invoices from 1946 through 1980 will have all been scanned!
subject: People

title: Newsletter 314:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Spring break - Part II. Camping in the 1950s was a chance to get back to nature and experience the wildlife, peace and serenity of the times. The present-day Drugstore gets a new 'Museum' sign! Three young men from Greenland stopped by and shared interesting information about their country.
subject: People;Camping

title: Newsletter 315:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Spring break - Part III. Without smartphones to predict weather conditions, folks had to take their chances when camping in the 1950s. An unexpected snowfall didn't spoil the fun, however! The Drugstore receives a $6400.00 grant from Rio Tonto to facilitate the scanning of 100,000 old invoices. Ultimately, they will be available at the National Archives in Washington, D.C.
subject: People;Rio Tonto;Camping

title: Newsletter 316:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: In addition to baseball and basketball, McGill had a football team as well. Uniforms were secured and practice began - sometime around 1909. More in Part II. The present-day Drugstore's sagging canopy repair is started.
subject: Football;Sports

title: Newsletter 317:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The first football game was played in East Ely on October 31, 1909. McGill was victorious over the Ely team by a score of 12-0. McGill also won the second game.
subject: Football;Sports

title: Newsletter 318:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The new 'Museum' signage on the Drugstore wall is helping to bring in new visitors. Relatives of a former McGill resident visit the Drugstore and identify their grandfather in one of the photos on the wall! Several visitors and former residents have supplied vintage photos for the Drugstore archive.
subject: Baseball;People;Drugstores

title: Newsletter 319:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Not all coyote encounters are negative. They can actually provide a benefit to ranchers and farmers. An image of the 1022 mill fire is included.
subject: Tragedies

title: Newsletter 320:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Remembering open day for fishing, circa 1944. A secret fishing spot is revealed. The present-day Drugstore gets a VIP visitor.
subject: Duck Creek;Bird Creek;Fishing;People

title: Newsletter 321:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The origin of the phrase "Kilroy was here" is discussed. The present-day Drugstore's back storeroom repairs are nearly complete.
subject: WWII

title: Newsletter 323:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The meaning of Independence Day and how the 1st and 2nd Amendments work together to ensure our freedom. McGill celebrated the 4th of July with enthusiasm during the 1940s and 1950s.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 324:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Many of McGill's residents left McGill for prestigious and fulfilling military, medical and government careers. This newsletter highlights some of them. Keith is honored to be chosen Grand Marshall of the 2025 4th of July Parade.
subject: People;Holidays

title: Newsletter 325:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Competition was alive and well in McGill in the 1940s and 1950s. No 'participation' trophies were given and there were no hard-feelings if your team lost. The desire to improve one's techniques and better themselves allowed kids to achieve their goals later in life. Susie Culbert, grand daughter of McGill residents Jerry and Elsa Culbert visits the Drugstore!
subject: Sports

title: Newsletter 326:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of McGill back in 1945, when the town was booming.
subject: Service Stations

title: Newsletter 327:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith shares an anecdote he heard from former McGill resident, Ivin Munson. Ivan recalled some drama regarding an attempted robbery at the JC Penney store when he was 10 years old.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 328:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Boredom did not exist for kids in McGill's early days. There were always things to do - things that didn't involve TV or computer games. Staying busy with hobbies or other outdoor activities went a long way towards keeping kids busy before technology invaded our daily life. Images of the 1922 mill fire are included.
subject: People;Tragedies

title: Newsletter 329:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Spring break, circa 1950. Camping was a fun activity to participate in during the Spring respite. Scanning begins on the 10 years of invoices from the 1960s. When completed, invoices from 1946 through 1980 will have all been scanned!
subject: Schools;People

title: Newsletter 330:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A 'right of passage' for most teenagers, the driver's license exam, as told by our own Keith Gibson!
subject: People

title: Newsletter 331:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Student bus drivers need a "chauffeur's" license to drive kids to school. Students who passed the test were hired as drivers and paid!
subject: Schools;People

title: Newsletter 332:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: We take for granted the task of washing clothing, what with the modern machines that exist today. Back in the day, washing the laundry was an all-day task and involved much manual labor.
subject: Businesses;Antiques

title: Newsletter 333:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The life of a McGill student bus driver was filled with some perks. Getting the kids to school and home on time meant skipping home period and early release for the drivers.
subject: Schools

title: Newsletter 334:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Driving the school bus to sporting events held many fond memories for Keith. Much responsibility was placed on kids back in the day. Can you imagine a high school student today driving a school bus?
subject: Schools;People

title: Newsletter 335:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Chevy roadshow comes to McGill! Vintage car owners motor through McGill and tour the Drugstore
subject: People;Automobiles

title: Newsletter 336:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls the many changes he has witnessed in automobile design and functionality.
subject: People;Automobiles

title: Newsletter 337:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A fun anecdote having to do with a nerve-racking winter drive to Salt Lake to return two nursing students to their homes in Ely. Present-day McGill gets a 'Holiday Room'.
subject: People;Automobiles

title: Newsletter 338:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: High School, marching band and hunting bring fond memories of October, 1950.
subject: People;Schools;Bassett Lake

title: Newsletter 340:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A good hunting dog is worth its weight in gold. Keith recalls his retriever, Tuffy, as well as his brother Paul's dog, Blackie. The present-day Drugstore gets a coat of fresh paint.
subject: People;Bassett Lake;Hunting;Drugstores

title: Newsletter 341:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Drugstore renovation continues with the help of many individuals and donations. The painting is completed, as well as a new main sign and 'MUSEUM' signage.
subject: Drugstores;Businesses

title: Newsletter 342:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The different methods used to heat the Drugstore over the years are discussed. The building that houses the heating system got a new corrugated metal roof, along with matching siding. This not only improves the look of the building, but (most importantly) will cut heating costs.
subject: Drugstores;Businesses

title: Newsletter 343:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: More discussion on the Drugstore heating system over the years. An image of the McGill circle area from the 1950s is included. The trees were beautiful, along with the expansive grassy area in front of the circle homes.
subject: Drugstores;Businesses

title: Newsletter 344:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memories of Thanksgiving, 1944, when FDR signed Proclamation 2629 to move Thanksgiving from November 30th back to November 23rd. The Gibson family celebrated Thanksgiving like many other families with Mom's delicious home-cooked turkey meal and pie for dessert.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 345:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill Antique store has a wonderful Christmas village on display, in addition to the stores collection of antiques. Stop by to see the village or shop for unique gifts. While you are in McGill, pay a visit to Bradley's Market.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 346:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Family and friends gathered together to wish Keith Gibson a happy 90th birthday! The celebration took place at the Kinnear Library. A book about the history of the McGill Drugstore is in the works.
subject: Drugstores

title: Newsletter 347:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Christmas of 1944 was celebrated while WWII was still raging. Toys were scarce so it was common for fathers to make things for their children. Keith recalls a special gift created by his father that he and his brother, Paul.
subject: Holidays;People

title: Newsletter 348:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The end of WWII brought a more joyful Christmas to the kids of McGill whose families remained whole after the war. Those families who lost loved ones in the war experienced a different Christmas that year.
subject: Holidays;People;WWII

title: Snowmageddon 1952
creator: Keith Gibson
description: McGill snowstorm covers homes in 1952.
subject: Schools

title: A young McGill baseball player - Earl Gibson
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Earl Gibson, father of Keith and Paul, circa 1922. The slag ditch tunnel is over his left shoulder.
subject: Banks

title: Billy Franks as the cowboy
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Chevy roadshow comes to McGill! Vintage car owners motor through McGill and tour the Drugstore.
subject: People

title: McGill's winning football team
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Steptoe Valley Football Team in 1912.
subject: Football

title: Dr. Steven Cuthbert and Family
creator: Keith Gibson
description: To read more about Dr. Steven Cuthbert and his ties to McGill, see NL 320.
subject: People

title: Armistice Day, 1917
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Armistice Day Parade, Ely, Nevada
subject: Parades;Holidays

title: Keith drives a bus!
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Our own Keith Gibson transported kids to and from school in 1953.
subject: Schools
